New Records: India made it nine wins from nine in the group stage
Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul forged a 208-run partnership, the highest fourth-wicket stand in World Cups
Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer (128 not out) and KL Rahul (102) hit centuries
Mohammed Siraj (two for 29) and Kuldeep Yadav (two for 41) took key wickets
Pre-Game Insights: India, the hosts, won the toss and opted to bat
The Netherlands were looking to pull off a record World Cup chase
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma praised the team's clinical performance
Shreyas Iyer credited his last few innings for giving him confidence
Miscellaneous Highlights: India scored 126 runs in their final 10 overs to post the third total above 400 in the event
The Netherlands got good starts from Max O'Dowd, Colin Ackermann, Sybrand Engelbrecht, and Teja Nidamanuru but never threatened
Others: India face New Zealand in the semi-finals on Wednesday
The Dutch captain, Scott Edwards, praised India's pure class with the bat
